title: BBC Local Live: Cambridgeshire on Tuesday, 8 March 2016 - BBC News
summary: an ambulance crashes with a car on newmarket road , cambridge .
planning committee to decide on development near a1 .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on wednesday .

documents.title: that 's all from cambridgeshire live
text: we 'll be back tomorrow with the latest news , sport , weather and travel updates for the county , between 08:00 and 18:00 .
and remember , you can contact us any time via email , facebook or twitter .

documents.title: international women 's day : rules for 1909 suffragettes game
text: cambridge university library has marked international women 's day by revealing this curiosity from its collection - the rules of a 1909 game pitching suffragettes against police .
the idea of the `` original and interesting '' game is for the player controlling the suffragettes to pass police lines and gain access to the house of commons .
you can read more about the the women 's suffrage movement here .

documents.title: appeal for witnesses after rape
text: police are appealing for witnesses after a woman was raped in march .
a woman in her 30s was walking home from a friend 's house at around 20:30 on sunday in an area known locally as the bmx park , when she stopped and asked a man for directions .
the 18-year-old white man is said to have then raped her before running away when a group of people appeared .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : heavy rain arriving overnight , persisting tomorrow
text: it will be cloudy with outbreaks of patchy rain or drizzle for much of the night before persistent , heavy rain starts to spread in from the west during the early hours .
minimum temperature : 4c ( 39f ) .
for a more detailed forecast for where you live head to bbc weather .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: headlines : police appeal for witnesses in march rape investigation postal woes prompt village name change
text: if you 're just joining us here are the headlines in cambridgeshire this evening :
author: Emma Maclean
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: police appeal for witnesses after violent attacks in peterborough
text: police are appealing for witnesses following two violent incidents in peterborough last night .
a man in his 20s received `` serious , but not life threatening '' injuries after being attacked by a group of up to 10 people in springnall , bretton .
in a separate incident , a man in his 40s received minor injuries after being assaulted by three or four men in paston , at about 22:30 .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: village changes names after postal woes
text: newton , near wisbech , is reverting to its original name newton in the isle .
the parish council says it 's `` to set us apart '' from the other 40 or so newtons .
about 80 % of residents of the village , which has a population of about 600 , voted to go back to the old name .

documents.title: six iraqi nationals found in lorry in chatteris
text: five men and a woman were found in the back of a lorry in chatteris this afternoon .
police stopped the vehicle in new road at 13:08 .
the six iraqi nationals were taken into custody at king 's lynn police investigation centre and will be handed over to immigration services .
author: Emma Maclean
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: tributes paid to 'exceptional ' cambridge student
text: tributes have been paid to `` exceptional '' cambridge university student thomas millward , who died following a fall at girton college on sunday .
thomas was an exceptional young man , warm and affectionate with everyone he met , always respectful and polite .
gifted both academically and in his sporting abilities , he excelled in everything that he did . ''
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: football : luton town goalkeeper rejoins peterborough united as player-coach
text: luton town goalkeeper mark tyler has joined former club peterborough united as a player-coach on a three month loan , with a view to a permanent move .
`` i am delighted to be back and i ca n't wait to start working with the goalkeepers at the club , '' he told the peterborough united club website .
author: Peter Swan
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire sport

documents.title: cambridge student 'died after receiving head injuries '
text: a cambridge engineering student died after suffering head injuries at girton college on sunday , police have said .
thomas millward , 19 , was taken to addenbrooke 's hospital , where he died at 11:00 .
police say his death is not being treated as sus but a 19-year-old woman from cambridge was arrested on sus of being involved in the supply of drugs .
she has been bailed to return to parkside police station in cambridge on 14 march .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: no injuries in cambridge ambulance crash
text: the ambulance service has confirmed that no-one was injured in a crash involving an ambulance and a car on newmarket road , cambridge , this afternoon .
two women with minor injuries were assessed at the scene but did n't require further treatment .
the road has now reopened .
author: Alex Harris
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: missing peterborough man may need urgent medical attention
text: police say a man who went missing from peterborough city hospital may need urgent medical attention .
rimas baltrusaitus , 53 , was last seen near rhubarb bridge , wearing white pyjamas , at 19:30 yesterday .
anyone with information about his whereabouts is asked to call police on 101 .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: thomas cook cancels flights to sharm
text: peterborough-based travel firm thomas cook has cancelled all bookings to sharm el-sheikh until at least november .
no flights have operated between the uk and sharm since 17 november after a russian plane crashed , killing 224 people .
the so-called islamic state subsequently claimed responsibility .
thomas cook says there is `` no clear indication as to when foreign and commonwealth office travel advice may change '' with regards to the destination .
author: Emma Maclean
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: crashed ambulance was en route to emergency call
text: an ambulance involved in a crash in cambridge was en route to an emergency call , according to the east anglian ambulance service .
it says there was no patient on board , and no staff were injured .
the crash happened on newmarket road , at about 13:10 .
author: Alex Harris
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: police confirm ambulance involved in cambridge crash
text: police have confirmed that an ambulance has been involved in a crash with a car on newmarket road in cambridge .
officers were called to the incident , on the junction with barnwell road .
the road remains blocked .
author: Alex Harris
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: weather : mostly dry with rain later
text: as we go through the afternoon , cloud will thicken and there will be outbreaks of light rain later..
maximum temperature : 6c ( 43f ) .
today 's overcast conditions were captured at histon , near cambridge , by bbc weather watcher 'cat 's pad ' .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: travel : cambridge 's newmarket road blocked after crash
text: newmarket road in cambridge is blocked at the junction with barnwell road following a crash involving an ambulance .
newmarket road # cambridge junction with barnwell road is blocked following a rtc avoid the area at this time .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: breakingambulance and car collide in cambridge
text: we 're getting reports that an ambulance has collided with a car on newmarket road , in cambridge .
more updates soon .
author: Alex Harris
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: cambridge windsurfer ben saxton selected for rio olym
text: the 2015 european champion , ben saxton from cambridge , has been selected for the great britain sailing team to take part in the rio olym
with team mate nicola groves , the 25-year-old will compete in the nacra 17 mixed multi-hull event , which also sees its first olympic games outing this year .
it 's the pair 's first olympic call-up .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Local Live

documents.title: headlines : doctor calls for more first aid training after toddler resuscitated by neighbour housing development before planners
text: the main lunchtime headlines :
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Local Live

documents.title: assurance 'same mistakes ' wo n't be made over housing development proposals
text: there are concerns a new housing development near peterborough could suffer from the same fate as the hamptons housing project , which waited 10 years before facilities promised were built .
roxhill , near the a1 ( m ) , was originally signposted as a business park , but now over 600 homes could also be built on part of the site .

in hampton , residents waited a decade for infrastructure projects to be constructed , but councillors set to make a decision on the planning application this afternoon are promising the same mistakes wo n't be repeated .
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: back to the future for newton
text: a fenland village is to revert back to its original name after officials gave the idea the green light .
for hundreds of years a little village near wisbech , with a population of 600 , was known as newton-in-the isle , but at some point the name was changed to just newton .
this change has come about through a village plan survey and 83 % of villagers were keen to change the name back to the old name of newton-in-the isle . ''

documents.title: 'data mining fears ' about 'total wipeout tour ' advert
text: people are being advised not to give out their details for an event which claims to be coming to cambridge later in the year .
the 'total wipeout tour ' has been advertised using photographs from the bbc television show , which is filmed in argentina and has nothing to do with the purported event .
details of the tour appeared on facebook until it was removed amid fears names and addresses were being collected to sell on to marketing companies .

documents.title: doctor backs calls for all parents to learn first aid
text: a doctor has backed calls for all parents to learn first aid after a toddler from warboys , who had a fit , was resuscitated by a neighbour .

dr mike knapton , associate medical director at the british heart foundation and a cambridge gp , said : `` there are about 30,000 out of hospital cardiac arrests per year and the chances of surviving at the moment are less than 1 in 10 .
`` the patient has already died by the time the emergency services get there . ''

documents.title: international women 's day : 'do n't let anything be a barrier '
text: on international women 's day , cambridgeshire fire and rescue is celebrating female firefighters :
`` do n't let anything be a barrier , just do it '' firefighter jo shippey # iwd2016 # notjustforboys
@ twitterid great article .
interesting .
i like her focus on different strengths within a team .
her example of adeptness in small spaces .

documents.title: more than £ 5000,000 to be spent on art project
text: a decision is due next week on homage to river cam :
biggest ever # cambridge public art project will pay homage to the cam # cmblive
@ twitterid is the city council 'arts ' dept still planning a £ 70k block of granite on parker 's piece to commemorate football rules ?

documents.title: peterborough planning decision over a1 development
text: the planning committee at peterborough city council will decide this afternoon if houses , rather than a business park , should be built on a development near the a1 .
it had been hoped that the development at roxhill , opposite the peterborough services , would create jobs for local residents , but now it could be that 610 homes are built instead .
those opposed to the housing say there are not enough jobs for people , or any schools .
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: driver arrested with cannabis in huntingdon
text: the road policing unit for cambridgeshire tweeted yesterday that they had arrested a driver carrying a bag of cannabis in huntingdon .
this news comes as the force undergoes a two-month campaign to tackle drug-driving .
bch road policing
roadpolicebch

we will be out looking for you .

documents.title: travel : a14 and a141 slow
text: there 's slow traffic on the a141 spittals way westbound in huntingdon , through the roadworks at the st peter 's road junction .
the a14 eastbound at j24 is slow due to an earlier broken down vehicle .
check the latest here .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: art lending library opens in peterborough
text: fancy freshening up your walls ?
well an art lending library is now open in peterborough .
users can hire pieces of art and display it in their homes for free for up to a week as part of the project , which has previously visited sunderland and glasgow .
the library will be based at arts organisation metal 's building , just behind peterborough town hall , until 24 march .

documents.title: couple 's first aid plea after son 's close call
text: a couple from warboys whose toddler was saved by a st john ambulance trainer is urging all parents to learn first aid .
kirsty and lewis mulholland nearly lost their son buddy at the end of january , when he suffered a convulsion , began fitting and stopped breathing .
the mother dashed across to her neighbour jim smith , who works for st john ambulance .
he started resuscitation and soon got him breathing again .
kirsty says jim is her `` guardian angel '' and the couple have signed up to learn first aid for children .
author: Katy Prickett
BBC News

documents.title: weather : frost clearing to leave bright day
text: there will be some early morning frost clearing to leave a dry and bright day , but cloud thickening and outbreaks of rain during mid-afternoon .
maximum temperature : 6c ( 43f ) .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: morning headlines : warboys couple stress first aid importance peterborough planning decision
text: the headlines :
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: welcome to local live for cambridgeshire
text: good morning and welcome to today 's live page for cambridgeshire .
we 'll bring you all the latest news , sport , weather and travel until 18:00 .
if you 'd like to get in touch , you can tweet us or email us here .
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live
